moves.5. d5 Nb4: I was expecting 5. ... Na5 followed by 6. ... b6.
moves.6... Na6: Nc5 will certainly be a thorn in white's side if he cannot get rid of the knight. So far so good though as white has a lead in development.
moves.7. O-O Bg4 8. Bb5+: Just to break the pin on the knight.
moves.8... Bd7 9. Bxd7+: It seems best to take as retreating allows the pin. Also, this is my bad bishop and his good bishop with the current pawn structure. I didn't want to take the knight with the bishop since he could plant his bishop on b5 and cause minor irritation.
moves.9... Qxd7 10. c4: Preventing the queen from getting to b5
moves.10... Nc5: Expected. Kingside development is good too though.
moves.11. Qc2: Defending the pawn and prevent Nd3.
moves.11... Nf6 12. Nc3 a6: ?? This loses the knight. b6 was better to provide an escape square.
moves.16. h3 Nf6 17. Bc3 Nh5: Getting the knight to f4 is good. Black should probably castle though or push f5 and storm my knights
moves.18. Rad1 O-O: f5 is still a good option.
moves.19. Bd2: The bishop shuffling by white seems to be a waste of time.
moves.19... b5 20. c5: This is better since my d pawn cannot be taken. Try to find why.
moves.20... dxc5 21. Nxc5 Qd8 22. Nxe5: This is a good position for me as I have plenty of attacking options. I think his best move is Bxc5 to take off the second knight.
moves.23. Bxh6: ! Where can black's queen safely move? There are other bishop moves by white that trap the queen.
moves.23... Qxd1 24. Qxd1: Better to take with the queen to threaten the knight.
moves.24... Nf6 25. Bg5: At this point, black timed out. It was a good game though. Thanks for watching.
